article.headline: Colorado 74, Radford 58
article.story: BOULDER, Colo. (AP) -- After struggling to beat one overmatched opponent just two days earlier, Colorado made sure this time. Sure, it wasn't as easy as it should have been, but it was still a whole lot better. Richard Roby scored 18 points and Chris Copeland added 16, helping Colorado win its fourth consecutive game with a 74-58 victory over Radford Thursday night. The Buffaloes had some breakdowns, but not nearly as many as in their nine-point victory over Missouri-Kansas City on Tuesday. "I thought we came out with a little more intensity early than last time," Colorado point guard Jason Obazuaye said. "Basically, we have to get up for everybody, just come out and get better as a team no matter what it says against the team's chest." Colorado (6-2) is in the midst of a relatively easy week, coming off a victory over Missouri-Kansas City with a game against Gardner-Webb coming up, and the Buffaloes didn't have much trouble against Radford. Playing its first game without forward Julius Ashby, who could be out up to two months with a torn foot tendon, Colorado used aggressive defense and a size advantage inside to go up big early. The Buffaloes didn't do much to extend a 16-point halftime lead, letting Radford pull within 10 with nine minutes left, but never really gave the Highlanders much of a chance to get back in it. Marcus Hall added 13 points for Colorado, which will face its first big challenge in about a month next Thursday at Utah, with the Big 12 season right after that. "I think our guys realize we've played a good schedule," Colorado coach Ricardo Patton. "You guys don't write that, but we've played a pretty good schedule and I think that will help us more than anything else." Radford (5-4) won five of its first eight games, though the caliber of opponents was nothing like facing Colorado. It showed. After beating the likes of Ferrum, Lees-McRae and Carson-Newman, the Highlanders had a little more trouble in their first game against a Big 12 opponent. Radford struggled getting into its offense against the bigger and more athletic Buffaloes and wasn't much better on defense, allowing Colorado plenty of layups and shots in the lane. The Buffaloes hit 15-of-26 shots in the second half and shot 50 percent overall. Chris Oliver had 15 points and eight rebounds to lead the Highlanders, who shot 37 percent and had 20 turnovers in their first game in 13 days. "Regardless of the talent level, regardless of the location, we're trying to get better for our season," Radford coach Byron Samuels said. "You don't have to be the tallest, the fastest, the strongest to play hard. And that's the message that we try to get across to our kids." Colorado gave Radford trouble from the start. Hall started things off with a 3-pointer on the game's first shot and Colorado opened with a 10-2 run, holding the Highlanders without a field goal until Olumuyiwa Popoola hit a short jumper at 16:42. Colorado got sloppy for a stretch to allow Radford to cut the lead to 19-13, but the Buffaloes followed with a 10-0 run to take control. Pressuring the Highlanders into mistakes and bad shots, Colorado scored 18 points off 12 turnovers in the first half and held the Highlanders to 8-of-25 shooting to take a 37-21 lead. "The first half we did not compete in any facet of the game," Samuels said. "I thought we weren't strong with the basketball, we had 12 turnovers, and I thought they outworked us on the offensive glass."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
